ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DATA=CAS-libref.data-table 
      
Specifies the input data table that contains process information for PROC SPC to analyze. 
CAS-libref specifies the CAS library where the input data table resides, and data-table 
specifies the name of the input data table.

Syntax: LIMITS=CAS-libref.data-table 
      
Names an input data table that contains preestablished control limits or the parameters from 
which control limits can be computed.

Syntax: NTHREADS=n 
      
Specifies the number of threads per node to be used to perform the analysis. You can specify 
a number between 1 and 64, inclusive. By default, n is the maximum number of threads available 
on each node.

Syntax: PROCESSNAME=variable 
      
Specifies the variable in the input data table that contains the names of processes to be analyzed.

Syntax: PROCESSVALUE=variable 
      
Specifies the variable in the input data table that contains process measurements to be analyzed. 
By default, PROC SPC looks for a variable named process that contains the process measurements.

Syntax: SUBGROUPNAME=variable 
      
Specifies the variable in the input data table that contains the names of subgroup variables.

Syntax: SUBGROUPVALUE=variable 
      
Specifies the variable in the input data table that contains subgroup values. Subgroup values 
identify rational subgroups for control chart analysis. By default, PROC SPC looks for a variable 
named subgroup that contains the subgroup values.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY variables; 
      
You can specify a BY statement in PROC SPC to obtain separate analyses of observations in groups 
that are defined by the values of the BY variables. If you specify more than one BY statement, 
only the last one specified is used.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the 
nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in 
the LIMITS= data table. Use the ALLN option in conjunction with the LIMITN= option or the variable 
_LIMITN_.

Specifies whether the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup means 
or for subgroup medians.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup means.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup medians.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control 
limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= 
option are positive.

Syntax: LIMITN=n
          
Specifies a nominal sample size for the control limits. 

If you specify LIMITN=n, the control limits are computed for the fixed value n, and they do not vary 
with the subgroup sample sizes.

Identifies a method for estimating the process mean, µ, which is represented by the central line on 
a median chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Average of subgroup means
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Average of subgroup medians
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Median of subgroup medians

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.
Suppresses the display of ODS output.

Syntax: OUTLIMITS=CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output data table that saves the control limits.

Syntax: CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output SAS data table that saves the information plotted on the chart, including the 
subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics and control limits.

Specifies one of five definitions used to calculate percentiles in the construction of box-and-whiskers plots
requested with the BOXCHART statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Definition 1 for computing quantile statistics
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Definition 2 for computing quantile statistics
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Definition 3 for computing quantile statistics
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Definition 4 for computing quantile statistics
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Definition 5 for computing quantile statistics

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: SIGMAS=k
          
Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup 
summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.
Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Calculates a median absolute deviation estimate for σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Calculates a median moving range estimate for σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Estimates σ based on a moving range of subgroup means.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup ranges.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup ranges.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup standard deviations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup standard deviations.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
TEST2RUN=run-length 

Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: 7 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: 8 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: 9 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: At least 10 out of 11 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: At least 12 out of 14 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: At least 16 out of 20 in a row

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TEST3RUN=run-length 
          
Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Length of the pattern is at least 6.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Length of the pattern is at least 7.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Length of the pattern is at least 8.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardized 
test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.
Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to overlapping patterns of points.

Syntax: TESTS=index-list
          
Requests one or more tests for special causes, which are also known as runs tests, pattern tests, 
and Western Electric rules.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: One point beyond Zone A (outside the control limits)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Nine points in a row in Zone C or beyond on one side of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Six points in a row steadily increasing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Fourteen points in a row alternating up and down
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Two out of three points in a row in Zone A or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Four out of five points in a row in Zone B or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Fifteen points in a row in Zone C on either or both sides of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Eight points in a row on either or both sides of the central line with no points in Zone C

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: CCHART < / options>;

The CCHART statement computes c charts for the numbers of nonconformities (defects) in subgroup samples.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the 
nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in 
the LIMITS= data table. Use the ALLN option in conjunction with the LIMITN= option or the variable 
_LIMITN_.

Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control 
limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= 
option are positive.

Syntax: LIMITN=n
          
Specifies a nominal sample size for the control limits. 

If you specify LIMITN=n, the control limits are computed for the fixed value n, and they do not vary 
with the subgroup sample sizes.
Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.
Suppresses the display of ODS output.

Syntax: OUTLIMITS=CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output data table that saves the control limits.

Syntax: CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output SAS data table that saves the information plotted on the chart, including the 
subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics and control limits.

Syntax: SIGMAS=k
          
Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup 
summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.

Syntax: SUBGROUPN=variable 
          
Specifies a variable in the input data table whose values specify the subgroup sample sizes.

TEST2RUN=run-length 

Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: IRCHART < / options>;

The IRCHART statement computes control charts for individual measurements and moving ranges.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control 
limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= 
option are positive.

Syntax: NMVGRANGE=n 
          
Specifies the number of consecutive subgroup summary statistics from which moving ranges are computed. 
Moving ranges are used to compute the estimate of the process standard deviation by the IRCHART statement, 
and by the XRCHART and XSCHART statements when you specify SMETHOD=MVGRANGE.
Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.
Suppresses the display of ODS output.

Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup ranges.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup standard deviations.

Syntax: PCHART < / options>;

The PCHART statement computes control charts for the proportions of nonconforming items in subgroup samples.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the 
nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in 
the LIMITS= data table. Use the ALLN option in conjunction with the LIMITN= option or the variable 
_LIMITN_.

Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control 
limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= 
option are positive.

Syntax: LIMITN=n
          
Specifies a nominal sample size for the control limits. 

If you specify LIMITN=n, the control limits are computed for the fixed value n, and they do not vary 
with the subgroup sample sizes.
Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.
Suppresses the display of ODS output.

Syntax: OUTLIMITS=CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output data table that saves the control limits.

Syntax: CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output SAS data table that saves the information plotted on the chart, including the 
subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics and control limits.

Syntax: SIGMAS=k
          
Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup 
summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.

Syntax: SUBGROUPN=variable 
          
Specifies a variable in the input data table whose values specify the subgroup sample sizes.

TEST2RUN=run-length 

Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: 7 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: 8 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: 9 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: At least 10 out of 11 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: At least 12 out of 14 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: At least 16 out of 20 in a row

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TEST3RUN=run-length 
          
Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Length of the pattern is at least 6.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Length of the pattern is at least 7.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Length of the pattern is at least 8.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardized 
test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.
Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to overlapping patterns of points.

Syntax: TESTS=index-list
          
Requests one or more tests for special causes, which are also known as runs tests, pattern tests, 
and Western Electric rules.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: One point beyond Zone A (outside the control limits)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Nine points in a row in Zone C or beyond on one side of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Six points in a row steadily increasing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Fourteen points in a row alternating up and down
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Two out of three points in a row in Zone A or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Four out of five points in a row in Zone B or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Fifteen points in a row in Zone C on either or both sides of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Eight points in a row on either or both sides of the central line with no points in Zone C

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: RCHART < / options>;

The RCHART statement computes control charts for subgroup ranges.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the 
nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in 
the LIMITS= data table. Use the ALLN option in conjunction with the LIMITN= option or the variable 
_LIMITN_.

Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control 
limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= 
option are positive.

Syntax: LIMITN=n
          
Specifies a nominal sample size for the control limits. 

If you specify LIMITN=n, the control limits are computed for the fixed value n, and they do not vary 
with the subgroup sample sizes.
Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.
Suppresses the display of ODS output.

Syntax: OUTLIMITS=CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output data table that saves the control limits.

Syntax: CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output SAS data table that saves the information plotted on the chart, including the 
subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics and control limits.

Syntax: SIGMAS=k
          
Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup 
summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.
Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Calculates a median absolute deviation estimate for σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Calculates a median moving range estimate for σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Estimates σ based on a moving range of subgroup means.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup ranges.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup ranges.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup standard deviations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup standard deviations.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
TEST2RUN=run-length 

Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: 7 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: 8 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: 9 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: At least 10 out of 11 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: At least 12 out of 14 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: At least 16 out of 20 in a row

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TEST3RUN=run-length 
          
Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Length of the pattern is at least 6.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Length of the pattern is at least 7.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Length of the pattern is at least 8.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardized 
test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.
Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to overlapping patterns of points.

Syntax: TESTS2=index-list
          
Requests one or more tests for special causes for an R chart or s chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: One point beyond Zone A (outside the control limits)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Nine points in a row in Zone C or beyond on one side of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Six points in a row steadily increasing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Fourteen points in a row alternating up and down
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Two out of three points in a row in Zone A or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Four out of five points in a row in Zone B or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Fifteen points in a row in Zone C on either or both sides of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Eight points in a row on either or both sides of the central line with no points in Zone C

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: XRCHART < / options>;

The XRCHART statement computes control charts for subgroup means and ranges.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the 
nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in 
the LIMITS= data table. Use the ALLN option in conjunction with the LIMITN= option or the variable 
_LIMITN_.

Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control 
limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= 
option are positive.

Syntax: LIMITN=n
          
Specifies a nominal sample size for the control limits. 

If you specify LIMITN=n, the control limits are computed for the fixed value n, and they do not vary 
with the subgroup sample sizes.

Syntax: NMVGRANGE=n 
          
Specifies the number of consecutive subgroup summary statistics from which moving ranges are computed. 
Moving ranges are used to compute the estimate of the process standard deviation by the IRCHART statement, 
and by the XRCHART and XSCHART statements when you specify SMETHOD=MVGRANGE.
Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.
Suppresses the display of ODS output.

Syntax: OUTLIMITS=CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output data table that saves the control limits.

Syntax: CAS-libref.data-table 
          
Creates an output SAS data table that saves the information plotted on the chart, including the 
subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics and control limits.

Syntax: SIGMAS=k
          
Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup 
summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.
Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Calculates a median absolute deviation estimate for σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Calculates a median moving range estimate for σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Estimates σ based on a moving range of subgroup means.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup ranges.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup ranges.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup standard deviations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup standard deviations.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: At least 16 out of 20 in a row

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TEST3RUN=run-length 
          
Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Length of the pattern is at least 6.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Length of the pattern is at least 7.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Length of the pattern is at least 8.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardized 
test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.
Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to overlapping patterns of points.

Syntax: TESTS=index-list
          
Requests one or more tests for special causes, which are also known as runs tests, pattern tests, 
and Western Electric rules.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: One point beyond Zone A (outside the control limits)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Nine points in a row in Zone C or beyond on one side of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Six points in a row steadily increasing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Fourteen points in a row alternating up and down
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Two out of three points in a row in Zone A or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Four out of five points in a row in Zone B or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Fifteen points in a row in Zone C on either or both sides of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Eight points in a row on either or both sides of the central line with no points in Zone C

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TESTS2=index-list
          
Requests one or more tests for special causes for an R chart or s chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: One point beyond Zone A (outside the control limits)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Nine points in a row in Zone C or beyond on one side of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Six points in a row steadily increasing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Fourteen points in a row alternating up and down
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Two out of three points in a row in Zone A or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Four out of five points in a row in Zone B or beyond
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Fifteen points in a row in Zone C on either or both sides of the central line
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Eight points in a row on either or both sides of the central line with no points in Zone C
